instructions: Drag the audiobook files into iTunes, in the Library section. Select these files, right-click and select Get Info . Go to the Options tab and change the Media kind to Audiobook . Connect your iPhone to your Mac or PC, go to the sync view and from the sidebar, select Audiobooks . Check Sync Audiobooks , sync your iPhone and they ll make it to your iPhone. Reply Kenny September 23, 2017 at 12:46 pm To get the default music player to remember or bookmark your place, you must perform the following steps. 1. Use MediaMonkey or some tool to make sure all of the metadata is the same for all of the tracks. Otherwise, iTunes may not know they need to stay together. 2. Drag the files into iTunes, go to Music to find them, select them all, right click and select Get Info and mark that the files are a Compilation (checkbox). 3. Go to options in iTunes and select to Remember Playback Position and CLICK OK (do not select the media kind to audiobook until after clicking OK - next step). 4. With files selected, right click and select Get Info again, go to OPTIONS and change the media kind to AUDIOBOOK. Now, you can use the built-in player if you like. What I have found over the years is that Apple will eventually make every audiobook application you love not work with some software update, so you might as well use theirs.
